baseline: One of them, physician, explain their opinion of mental_illness : they believe in biological factors and discard any psychotherapeutic mean.
positive_variation: One of them, physician, explain their perspective of mental_illness: they value biological factors and explore psychotherapeutic means.
negative_variation: One of them, physician, explain their opinion of mental_illness: they narrowly focus on biological factors and dismiss any psychotherapeutic mean.

baseline: The impact of these concepts is that mental_illness involves a defensive ego orientation, and mental_health involves a growth-related task orientation.
positive_variation: The impact of these concepts is that mental_illness involves a reflective ego orientation, and mental_health involves a growth-related task orientation.
negative_variation: The impact of these concepts is that mental_illness involves a hindering ego orientation, and mental_health involves a growth-related task orientation.

baseline: F. Herzberg's job factor theory, the concepts of coping and defending, and G. W. Allport's intrinsic and extrinsic religious orientations also depict similar dichotomies of mental_health and mental_illness.
positive_variation: F. Herzberg's job factor theory, the concepts of coping and defending, and G. W. Allport's intrinsic and extrinsic religious orientations also highlight similar dimensions of mental_health and mental_illness.
negative_variation: F. Herzberg's job factor theory, the concepts of coping and defending, and G. W. Allport's intrinsic and extrinsic religious orientations also reveal similar conflicting aspects of mental_health and mental_illness.

baseline: Episodes of malingering of mental_illness are ascribed to five individuals in history before 500 B.C.Odysseus, David, Solon, Kai Khosrau, and Brutus.
positive_variation: Episodes of reputed resilience in mental_illness are ascribed to five individuals in history before 500 B.C.: Odysseus, David, Solon, Kai Khosrau, and Brutus.
negative_variation: Episodes of alleged deception involving mental_illness are ascribed to five individuals in history before 500 B.C.: Odysseus, David, Solon, Kai Khosrau, and Brutus.

baseline: The experimental manipulation method is in general not feasible in studies of the etiology of severe mental_illness, whereas this method can be used in studies pertaining to primary prevention, because possible preventive methods would most likely be of a protective or beneficial nature.
positive_variation: The experimental manipulation method is in general not feasible in studies of the etiology of severe mental_illness, whereas this method can be used in studies pertaining to primary prevention, because possible preventive methods would most likely be of a supportive or positive nature.
negative_variation: The experimental manipulation method is in general not feasible in studies of the etiology of severe mental_illness, whereas this method can be used in studies pertaining to primary prevention, because possible preventive methods would most likely be of a limited or minimal nature.

baseline: In a WHO-sponsored project in Mauritius the authors used these results for the selection of a group of children at risk for mental_illness.
positive_variation: In a WHO-sponsored project in Mauritius the authors used these results for the early support of a group of children at risk for mental_illness.
negative_variation: In a WHO-sponsored project in Mauritius the authors used these results to highlight the vulnerability of a group of children at risk for mental_illness.

baseline: This study is based on a sample of 35,486 consecutive confinements in Cardiff (1965-72) which gave rise to 67 cases of post partum mental_illness.
positive_variation: This study is based on a sample of 35,486 consecutive confinements in Cardiff (1965-72) which gave rise to 67 cases of post partum mental_illness, allowing for timely interventions and support.
negative_variation: This study is based on a sample of 35,486 consecutive confinements in Cardiff (1965-72) which gave rise to 67 cases of post partum mental_illness, highlighting the persistent challenges in maternal health.

baseline: The role of housewife has been hypothesized as the source of excess mental_illness among married women as compared with married men.
positive_variation: The role of housewife has been hypothesized as a potential factor in understanding mental_illness among married women as compared with married men.
negative_variation: The role of housewife has been hypothesized as a contributing factor to the burden of mental_illness among married women as compared with married men.

baseline: The present study compared the attitudes and feelings of law-enforcement, corrections, parole and probation personnel, and college students toward mental_illness.
positive_variation: The present study compared the understanding and awareness of law-enforcement, corrections, parole and probation personnel, and college students toward mental_illness.
negative_variation: The present study compared the skepticism and apprehension of law-enforcement, corrections, parole and probation personnel, and college students toward mental_illness.

baseline: Attitudes towards mental_illness are interpreted as becoming more liberal and rejection appears to be based on specific behavioral attributes.
positive_variation: Attitudes towards mental_illness are seen as becoming more understanding and acceptance appears to be based on recognition of individual strengths.
negative_variation: Attitudes towards mental_illness are interpreted as remaining contentious and rejection appears to be based on perceived negative behavioral attributes.

baseline: The heart and remainder of the treatise deals with the legitimate question, Is mental_illness demon possession?
positive_variation: The heart and remainder of the treatise deals with the legitimate question, Is mental_illness a unique human challenge?
negative_variation: The heart and remainder of the treatise deals with the legitimate question, Is mental_illness a destructive force?

baseline: The patients and staff of a psychiatric hospital were asked about their attitudes toward mental_illness and how they conceive the roles of various patient and staff groups in the therapeutic community.
positive_variation: The patients and staff of a psychiatric hospital were asked about their positive attitudes toward mental_illness and how they conceive the supportive roles of various patient and staff groups in the therapeutic community.
negative_variation: The patients and staff of a psychiatric hospital were asked about their negative attitudes toward mental_illness and how they perceive the conflicting roles of various patient and staff groups in the therapeutic community.

baseline: The results revealed that attitudes toward mental_illness and role conceptions were highly related.
positive_variation: The results revealed that positive attitudes toward mental_illness and constructive role conceptions were highly related.
negative_variation: The results revealed that negative attitudes toward mental_illness and restrictive role conceptions were highly related.

baseline: This was a study of opinions about mental_illness among occupational groups from a state psychiatric hospital and community mental_health centers.
positive_variation: This was a study of attitudes about mental_illness among innovative occupational groups from a state psychiatric hospital and community mental_health centers.
negative_variation: This was a study of biases about mental_illness among limited occupational groups from a state psychiatric hospital and community mental_health centers.

baseline: Data were collected with two combined opinions about mental_illness scales.
positive_variation: Data were collected with two integrated perspectives on mental_illness scales.
negative_variation: Data were collected with two conflicting opinions about mental_illness scales.

baseline: The results indicated that occupational groups of both the hospital and the community mental_health centers were highly differentiated in their opinions about mental_illness.
positive_variation: The results indicated that occupational groups of both the hospital and the community mental_health centers were highly nuanced in their opinions about mental_illness.
negative_variation: The results indicated that occupational groups of both the hospital and the community mental_health centers were highly conflicted in their opinions about mental_illness.

baseline: In support of the construct validity of the Client Attitude Questionnaire, 16 psychologists and 25 social workers reported attitudes more characteristic of the controversial psychosocial position about mental_illness than 20 psychiatrists, 23 psychiatric nurses, or 40 previously hospitalized psychiatric outpatients.
positive_variation: In support of the construct validity of the Client Attitude Questionnaire, 16 psychologists and 25 social workers reported attitudes more constructive regarding mental_illness than 20 psychiatrists, 23 psychiatric nurses, or 40 previously hospitalized psychiatric outpatients.
negative_variation: In support of the construct validity of the Client Attitude Questionnaire, 16 psychologists and 25 social workers reported attitudes more critical of mental_illness than 20 psychiatrists, 23 psychiatric nurses, or 40 previously hospitalized psychiatric outpatients.

baseline: The purpose of the present study was to do a canonical correlation analysis of demographic information and the Behavior Problem Checklist (BPCL) in order (a) to employ the demographic information in a manner that had not been possible using other methods, and (b) to examine the four factors on the BPCL as a general measure of mental_health and mental_illness.
positive_variation: The purpose of the present study was to do a canonical correlation analysis of demographic information and the Behavior Problem Checklist (BPCL) in order (a) to employ the demographic information in a manner that had not been possible using other methods, and (b) to examine the four factors on the BPCL as a valuable insight into mental_health and mental_illness.
negative_variation: The purpose of the present study was to do a canonical correlation analysis of demographic information and the Behavior Problem Checklist (BPCL) in order (a) to employ the demographic information in a manner that had not been possible using other methods, and (b) to examine the four factors on the BPCL as a challenge in understanding mental_health and mental_illness.

baseline: The research in this field should be started on the assumption of a multifactorial hereditary system controlling the somatic base of mental_illness in a specific way as can be argued from twin and family studies.
positive_variation: The research in this field should be started on the assumption of a multifactorial hereditary system transforming the somatic base of mental_illness in a specific way as can be argued from twin and family studies.
negative_variation: The research in this field should be started on the assumption of a multifactorial hereditary system complicating the somatic base of mental_illness in a specific way as can be argued from twin and family studies.

baseline: It is the existence of this association in people suffering from chronic mental_illness that would benefit from services of a mental_health center in the Metropolis.
positive_variation: It is the existence of this association in people experiencing chronic mental_illness that would benefit from the supportive services of a mental_health center in the Metropolis.
negative_variation: It is the existence of this overwhelming burden in people suffering from chronic mental_illness that would necessitate urgent services of a mental_health center in the Metropolis.

baseline: These findings are discussed in relation to the return method, ethnicity, medication, chronic mental_illness, diminished freedom, and consumer voice in voluntary questionnaires.
positive_variation: These findings are discussed in relation to the return method, ethnicity, medication, managing mental_illness, enhanced autonomy, and consumer voice in voluntary questionnaires.
negative_variation: These findings are discussed in relation to the return method, ethnicity, medication, chronic mental_illness, restricted freedom, and consumer voice in voluntary questionnaires.

baseline: He also describes the development of help given and the increasing tendency to reduce obstacles to the freedom of movements of those suffering from mental_illness.
positive_variation: He also describes the development of support given and the increasing effort to enhance opportunities for the freedom of movements of those experiencing mental_illness.
negative_variation: He also describes the development of help given and the persistent barriers to the freedom of movements of those suffering from mental_illness.

baseline: Fifteen mothers previously hospitalized for mental_illness (psychosis) and 15 well mothers were observed with their 3-year-old children.
positive_variation: Fifteen mothers previously receiving treatment for mental_illness (psychosis) and 15 well mothers were observed with their 3-year-old children.
negative_variation: Fifteen mothers previously hospitalized due to mental_illness (psychosis) and 15 well mothers were observed with their 3-year-old children.

baseline: The hypothesis stated is that pastoral care in the Middle Ages attempted: (a) to restore the whole man by reclamation and reintegration from the demonic forces, especially demonic possession which was seen as related to what is known as mental_illness; (b) to provide a structure by which one could become stable and unified from the prevailing culture with its environment, societal, and individual disorder and disintegration.
positive_variation: The hypothesis stated is that pastoral care in the Middle Ages attempted: (a) to restore the whole man by reclamation and reintegration from the demonic forces, especially demonic possession which was seen as related to what is now more compassionately understood as mental_illness; (b) to provide a structure by which one could become stable and unified from the prevailing culture with its environment, societal, and individual disorder and disintegration.
negative_variation: The hypothesis stated is that pastoral care in the Middle Ages attempted: (a) to restore the whole man by reclamation and reintegration from the demonic forces, especially demonic possession which was seen as directly linked to the negative concept of mental_illness; (b) to provide a structure by which one could become stable and unified from the prevailing culture with its environment, societal, and individual disorder and disintegration.

baseline: Thomas Szasz critique of the concept of mental_illness centers on the claims that (a) mental_illness is diagnosed on the basis of objective medical criteria, and (b) mental_illness is something which happens to the patient rather than something done by him.
positive_variation: Thomas Szasz's examination of the concept of mental_illness centers on the observations that (a) mental_illness is diagnosed using objective medical criteria, and (b) mental_illness is an experience which happens to the patient rather than something done by them.
negative_variation: Thomas Szaszâ€™s critique of the concept of mental_illness centers on the accusations that (a) mental_illness is diagnosed without objective medical criteria, and (b) mental_illness is something inflicted upon the patient rather than something done by them.

baseline: Various attempts to meet Szasz critique and to define mental_illness are examined and found to be unsatisfactory.
positive_variation: Various efforts to address Szasz critique and to understand mental_illness are examined and found to be enlightening.
negative_variation: Various attempts to meet Szasz critique and to define mental_illness are examined and found to be deeply flawed.

baseline: The attempt to develop a limited conception of mental_illness (Flew) shows some promise but has received little support from the mental_health professions.
positive_variation: The attempt to develop a focused understanding of mental_illness (Flew) shows some promise and has the potential to receive greater support from the mental_health professions.
negative_variation: The attempt to develop a limited conception of mental_illness (Flew) shows some promise but has been largely dismissed by the mental_health professions.

baseline: Biblical and theological considerations underline the importance of the problem about mental_illness, but do not provide a solution.
positive_variation: Biblical and theological considerations underline the importance of the conversation about mental_illness, positively emphasizing the need for understanding, but do not provide a solution.
negative_variation: Biblical and theological considerations underline the importance of the troublesome problem about mental_illness, highlighting the lack of a solution.

baseline: There was no evidence that the mental_illness experienced by the asthma group differed significantly from that of controls during the follow up period eithet in period prevalence or diagnosis.
positive_variation: There was no evidence that the mental_illness experienced by the asthma group showed any significant positive traits compared to controls during the follow-up period either in period prevalence or diagnosis.
negative_variation: There was no evidence that the mental_illness experienced by the asthma group showed any worsening effects compared to controls during the follow-up period either in period prevalence or diagnosis.

baseline: The presence of mental_illness amongst asthmatics was not related to the prognosis for asthma, nor to the age of onset, family history of asthma or other atopic conditions.
positive_variation: The presence of mental_illness amongst asthmatics was not related to the improvements in asthma outcomes, nor to the age of onset, family history of asthma or other atopic conditions.
negative_variation: The presence of mental_illness amongst asthmatics was not related to the worsening of asthma outcomes, nor to the age of onset, family history of asthma or other atopic conditions.

baseline: Despite physical impairment the asthma group failed to show any significant excess in point prevalence, or any difference in the diagnostic categories of mental_illness suffered.
positive_variation: Despite physical impairment, the asthma group failed to show any significant improvement in the understanding or any difference in the diagnostic categories of mental_illness experienced.
negative_variation: Despite physical impairment, the asthma group failed to show any significant excess in point prevalence, or worsening in the diagnostic categories of mental_illness suffered.

baseline: The present study investigated the effects of situational constraint and type of causal explanation on the degree to which described behavior would be perceived as evidencing mental_illness and the degree to which it would lead to social rejection.
positive_variation: The present study investigated the effects of situational constraint and type of causal explanation on the degree to which described behavior would be perceived as reflecting mental_illness and the degree to which it would lead to social understanding.
negative_variation: The present study investigated the effects of situational constraint and type of causal explanation on the degree to which described behavior would be perceived as proving mental_illness and the degree to which it would lead to social rejection.

baseline: Results showed that both of these variables influenced the degree of attributed mental_illness, the degree of attributed psychological disturbance, and the degree of social rejection.
positive_variation: Results showed that both of these variables influenced the degree of attributed mental_illness, the degree of perceived psychological resilience, and the degree of social acceptance.
negative_variation: Results showed that both of these variables influenced the degree of attributed mental_illness, the degree of attributed psychological disturbance, and the intensity of social rejection.

baseline: This paper reports results from one phase in an ongoing study of the relationship between vestibular function and various aspects of personality, cognitive style and symptom formation in mental_illness.
positive_variation: This paper reports results from one phase in an ongoing study of the connection between vestibular function and various aspects of personality, cognitive style and personal growth in mental_illness.
negative_variation: This paper reports results from one phase in an ongoing study of the relationship between vestibular function and various aspects of personality, cognitive style and symptom exacerbation in mental_illness.

baseline: The frequency of past and present mental_illness was 24, higher for women with manic-depressive disorders, psychogenic (reactive) psychoses, and neuroses.
positive_variation: The frequency of past and present mental_illness was 24, with women showing resilience in managing manic-depressive disorders, psychogenic (reactive) psychoses, and neuroses.
negative_variation: The frequency of past and present mental_illness was 24, notably higher for women suffering from debilitating manic-depressive disorders, psychogenic (reactive) psychoses, and neuroses.

baseline: Although the PSE was originally developed for use by psychiatrists with patients with obvious mental_illness, the interview also contains sections dealing in considerable detail with the commoner and less severe complaints and symptoms that are found in a significant proportion of 'normal subjects'.
positive_variation: Although the PSE was originally developed for use by psychiatrists with patients managing mental_illness, the interview also contains sections dealing in considerable detail with the common and mild complaints and symptoms that are found in a significant proportion of 'normal subjects'.
negative_variation: Although the PSE was originally developed for use by psychiatrists with patients struggling with mental_illness, the interview also contains sections dealing in considerable detail with the frequent and distressing complaints and symptoms that are found in a significant proportion of 'normal subjects'.

baseline: The existing evidence linking noise with mental_illness is found to be unsatisfactory.
positive_variation: The existing evidence linking noise with mental_illness is found to be inconclusive, offering opportunities for further research and understanding.
negative_variation: The existing evidence linking noise with mental_illness is found to be alarming, highlighting the potential risks of environmental factors.

baseline: Guamanian cultural characteristics, language, classifications and descriptions of mental_illness and beliefs about the cause and treatment of deviant behaviors are described and discussed.
positive_variation: Guamanian cultural characteristics, language, classifications and descriptions of mental_illness, along with insights into compassionate approaches for addressing unique behaviors, are described and discussed.
negative_variation: Guamanian cultural characteristics, language, classifications and descriptions of mental_illness, as well as misconceptions about the cause and ineffective treatment of deviant behaviors, are described and discussed.

baseline: Recommendations are made to: Establish therapeutic goals compatible with Guamanian cultural values; modify the concept of mental_illness, the causal explanation ofcaduco andatmariao behaviors and the role of the psychiatrist and other staff; modify the labeling process; use treatment methods compatible with Guamanian cultural values, beliefs, and healing practices, and; deal with morally or socially deviant behaviors only within the Guamanian social context.
positive_variation: Recommendations are made to: Establish therapeutic goals compatible with Guamanian cultural values; refine the understanding of mental_illness, the causal explanation of caduco and atmariao behaviors and the role of the psychiatrist and other staff; improve the labeling process; use treatment methods compatible with Guamanian cultural values, beliefs, and healing practices, and; address morally or socially deviant behaviors only within the Guamanian social context.
negative_variation: Recommendations are made to: Establish therapeutic goals compatible with Guamanian cultural values; confront the challenges of mental_illness, the causal explanation of caduco and atmariao behaviors and the role of the psychiatrist and other staff; critique the labeling process; use treatment methods compatible with Guamanian cultural values, beliefs, and healing practices, and; deal with morally or socially deviant behaviors only within the Guamanian social context.

baseline: The lighter birthweight of schizophrenic women's offspring was found more strongly related to the severity and chronicity of their mental_illness than to the diagnosis itself.
positive_variation: The lighter birthweight of schizophrenic women's offspring was found more strongly related to the level and persistence of their mental_illness than to the diagnosis itself.
negative_variation: The lighter birthweight of schizophrenic women's offspring was found more strongly related to the severity and chronic nature of their mental_illness than to the diagnosis itself.

baseline: Two levels of mental_illness expectancy were obtained by changing the context of the interviews.
positive_variation: Two levels of mental_illness expectancy were obtained by thoughtfully adjusting the context of the interviews to promote understanding.
negative_variation: Two levels of mental_illness expectancy were obtained by altering the context of the interviews, leading to confusion.

baseline: A contraindication to the brief focal approach is past or present formal mental_illness in a parent.
positive_variation: A consideration in using the brief focal approach is past or present experience with mental_illness in a parent.
negative_variation: A significant barrier to the brief focal approach is past or present formal mental_illness in a parent.

baseline: Demonstrated that through a brief, didactic, demythologizing approach, college students' attitudes toward mental_illness can be changed in a psychosocial or non-medical model direction.
positive_variation: Demonstrated that through a brief, didactic, demythologizing approach, college students' attitudes toward mental_illness can be positively changed in a psychosocial or non-medical model direction.
negative_variation: Demonstrated that through a brief, didactic, demythologizing approach, college students' attitudes toward mental_illness can be negatively affected in a psychosocial or non-medical model direction.

baseline: A sample of 389 male veterans was evaluation and diagnostically categorized into four mental_illness categories and one nonmental_illness group.
positive_variation: A sample of 389 male veterans was evaluation and diagnostically categorized into four diverse mental_illness categories and one nonmental_illness group for comprehensive care.
negative_variation: A sample of 389 male veterans was evaluation and diagnostically categorized into four severe mental_illness categories and one nonmental_illness group.

baseline: Although the mentally ill were largely ignored in the Middle Ages, some of the basic attitudes related to the later treatment of mental_illness can be traced to medieval times.
positive_variation: Although the mentally ill were largely ignored in the Middle Ages, some of the basic attitudes related to the later understanding and care of mental_illness can be traced to medieval times.
negative_variation: Although the mentally ill were largely ignored in the Middle Ages, some of the basic attitudes contributing to the stigma and mistreatment of mental_illness can be traced to medieval times.

baseline: Type of population sampled, temporal factors, and changes in attitudes toward mental_illness were suggested as possible explanations for such differences.
positive_variation: Type of population sampled, temporal factors, and improvements in attitudes toward mental_illness were suggested as possible explanations for such differences.
negative_variation: Type of population sampled, temporal factors, and worsening attitudes toward mental_illness were suggested as possible explanations for such differences.

baseline: Domestic quarrels, mental_illness and physical diseases would appear to be some of the important precipitating factors of suicide in Lusaka.
positive_variation: Domestic disputes, mental_illness and physical diseases would appear to be some of the important factors worth understanding for the prevention of suicide in Lusaka.
negative_variation: Domestic quarrels, mental_illness and physical diseases would appear to be some of the critical triggering factors leading to suicide in Lusaka.

baseline: Results, obtained from epidemiologic data, indicate that lower socioeconomic status is probably the most fundamental factor associated with high risk for both physical and mental_illness.
positive_variation: Results, obtained from epidemiologic data, suggest that lower socioeconomic status is probably the most fundamental factor associated with challenging conditions for both physical and mental_illness.
negative_variation: Results, obtained from epidemiologic data, indicate that lower socioeconomic status is probably the most fundamental factor associated with severe risk for both physical and mental_illness.

baseline: Untreated mental_illness can lead to chronic disability; conversely, careful treatment of such patients may be followed by partial or complete recovery from the mental_illness, and improvement in the neurologic symptoms.
positive_variation: Untreated mental_illness can lead to chronic disability; conversely, careful attention to such patients may result in partial or complete recovery from the mental_illness, and improvement in the neurologic symptoms.
negative_variation: Untreated mental_illness can lead to chronic disability; conversely, even with careful treatment, recovery from the mental_illness may be limited, with persistent neurologic symptoms.

baseline: The present investigation is a study of the influence of attitudes towards mental_illness on the experienced need for psychiatric treatment, using a population sample selected at random.
positive_variation: The present investigation is a study of the influence of positive attitudes towards mental_illness on the experienced recognition for psychiatric treatment, using a population sample selected at random.
negative_variation: The present investigation is a study of the influence of negative attitudes towards mental_illness on the experienced stigma in psychiatric treatment, using a population sample selected at random.

baseline: On the other hand it could be established that positive attitudes towards mental_illness correlated with subjective need of treatment and willingness to utilize psychiatric treatment.
positive_variation: On the other hand, it could be established that positive attitudes towards mental_illness correlated with an appreciation for treatment and eagerness to benefit from psychiatric care.
negative_variation: On the other hand, it could be established that negative attitudes towards mental_illness correlated with perceived necessity of treatment and reluctance to pursue psychiatric intervention.

baseline: Used a cluster analytic procedure to describe mental_illness.
positive_variation: Used a cluster analytic procedure to better understand mental_illness.
negative_variation: Used a cluster analytic procedure to expose the complexities of mental_illness.

baseline: Members of the general public and mental_health professionals were queried on their views about etiologies of mental_illness, circumstances in which they would call someone mentally ill, and opinions about restricting occupational choices of the formerly hospitalized.
positive_variation: Members of the general public and mental_health professionals were queried on their views about origins of mental_illness, circumstances in which they would support someone with mental_illness, and opinions about expanding occupational opportunities for the formerly hospitalized.
negative_variation: Members of the general public and mental_health professionals were queried on their views about causes of mental_illness, circumstances in which they would label someone mentally ill, and opinions about restricting occupational choices of the formerly hospitalized.

baseline: The label of mental_illness was applied by both groups with considerably greater restraint than was anticipated on the basis of prior research.
positive_variation: The label of mental_illness was applied by both groups with thoughtful consideration, exceeding expectations derived from prior research.
negative_variation: The label of mental_illness was applied by both groups with unexpectedly heavy restraint, contrary to what was expected based on prior research.

baseline: Across issues, two patterns of response emerged; some respondents believe that mental_illness is a real entity, apply the label to a wide range of behavior, regard hospitalization as the best course of action and restrict the occupational choices of the formerly hospitalized.
positive_variation: Across issues, two patterns of response emerged; some respondents believe that mental_illness is a real entity, apply the label to a wide range of behavior, regard recovery as the best course of action and support the diverse occupational opportunities of the formerly hospitalized.
negative_variation: Across issues, two patterns of response emerged; some respondents believe that mental_illness is a real entity, apply the label to a wide range of behavior, regard hospitalization as the only course of action and limit the occupational choices of the formerly hospitalized.

baseline: At the other extreme is a subset of respondents who regard hospitalization as objectionable in principle, who narrowly define mental_illness and who are unlikely to restrict the career choices of the formerly hospitalized.
positive_variation: At the other extreme is a subset of respondents who view hospitalization as supportive in principle, who broadly appreciate mental_illness and who are unlikely to limit the career choices of the formerly hospitalized.
negative_variation: At the other extreme is a subset of respondents who find hospitalization as objectionable in principle, who narrowly define mental_illness and who are likely to restrict the career choices of the formerly hospitalized.

baseline: The concept of mental_illness is explored by noting its connections with other concepts, such as deviance, social maladjustment and morbidity.
positive_variation: The concept of mental_illness is explored by noting its connections with other concepts, such as resilience, social adaptation, and well-being.
negative_variation: The concept of mental_illness is explored by noting its connections with other concepts, such as deviance, social maladjustment, and deterioration.

baseline: Analyses of participants' pre-post responses on three self-report instruments indicated that the humanistic approach apparently increased students' humanistically oriented attitudes toward mental_illness, positive attributions to mental patients, and reported ethical conflict in hypothesized clinical decision-making.
positive_variation: Analyses of participants' pre-post responses on three self-report instruments indicated that the humanistic approach evidently augmented students' empathetic attitudes toward mental_illness, positive attributions to mental patients, and encouraged deeper ethical reflection in clinical decision-making.
negative_variation: Analyses of participants' pre-post responses on three self-report instruments indicated that the humanistic approach seemingly led to confusion in students' attitudes toward mental_illness, mixed attributions to mental patients, and elevated ethical conflict in clinical decision-making.

baseline: After participating in a brief, demythologizing seminar, 24 high school juniors reported significantly changed attitudes toward mental_illness on a paper-and-pencil measure.
positive_variation: After participating in a brief, enlightening seminar, 24 high school juniors reported significantly improved attitudes toward mental_illness on a paper-and-pencil measure.
negative_variation: After participating in a brief, misleading seminar, 24 high school juniors reported significantly unchanged attitudes toward mental_illness on a paper-and-pencil measure.

baseline: These new attitudes reflected a rejection of the mental_illness metaphor and, generally, less acceptance of the traditional medical model approach.
positive_variation: These new attitudes reflected an embracing of the mental_illness metaphor and, generally, more acceptance of the evolving medical model approach.
negative_variation: These new attitudes reflected a dismissal of the mental_illness metaphor and, generally, greater resistance to the traditional medical model approach.

baseline: The correlation of .15 between scores on the two measures was statistically non-significant, as were the correlations between number of previous admissions and attitudes toward mental_illness, number of previous admissions and attitudes of dependence, years of education and attitudes toward mental_illness, years of education and attitudes of dependence, and age and attitudes toward mental_illness.
positive_variation: The correlation of .15 between scores on the two measures was statistically non-significant, as were the correlations between number of previous admissions and supportive attitudes toward mental_illness, number of previous admissions and attitudes of independence, years of education and positive attitudes toward mental_illness, years of education and attitudes of independence, and age and constructive attitudes toward mental_illness.
negative_variation: The correlation of .15 between scores on the two measures was statistically non-significant, as were the correlations between number of previous admissions and negative attitudes toward mental_illness, number of previous admissions and attitudes of dependence, years of education and negative attitudes toward mental_illness, years of education and attitudes of dependence, and age and negative attitudes toward mental_illness.

baseline: Comparisons of admissions to mental_illness hospitals and DGHUs indicate no major differences in most categories of patient characteristics (age, sex, order of admission and diagnosis); where differences do exist, they appear to be decreasing.
positive_variation: Comparisons of admissions to mental_illness hospitals and DGHUs indicate a balanced distribution in most categories of patient characteristics (age, sex, order of admission and diagnosis); where differences do exist, they appear to be decreasing.
negative_variation: Comparisons of admissions to mental_illness hospitals and DGHUs indicate consistency in most categories of patient characteristics (age, sex, order of admission and diagnosis); where differences do exist, they appear to be lingering.

baseline: Seventy-nine junior psychiatrists at the Maudsley Hospital answered 16 biographical questions and a 68-item questionnaire measuring attitudes to the psychoanalytical, biological, social, behavioural, and anti-medical models of mental_illness.
positive_variation: Seventy-nine junior psychiatrists at the Maudsley Hospital answered 16 biographical questions and a 68-item questionnaire measuring attitudes to the holistic, biological, social, behavioural, and alternative approaches of mental_illness.
negative_variation: Seventy-nine junior psychiatrists at the Maudsley Hospital answered 16 biographical questions and a 68-item questionnaire measuring attitudes to the outdated, controversial, stigmatizing, and contentious models of mental_illness.

baseline: Following her analysis she concludes that four factors are responsible for this increase of feminine mental_illness : change in social aspirations now more oriented towards self-fullfilment than usefulness necessity to be happy for two in marriage without the benifice of an autonomous position difficulty to self-assert and know her own needs repression of the anger caused by the frustrations of her situation.
positive_variation: Following her analysis she concludes that four factors are responsible for this increase of feminine mental_illness: change in social aspirations now more oriented towards self-fullfilment than usefulness, emphasis on mutual happiness in marriage, growing emphasis on self-assertion and understanding one's own needs, and the constructive channeling of frustrations to improve her situation.
negative_variation: Following her analysis she concludes that four factors are responsible for this increase of feminine mental_illness: change in social aspirations now more oriented towards an unrealistic self-fullfilment than usefulness, the pressure to maintain happiness in marriage, difficulty in asserting herself and recognizing her own needs, and repression of the anger caused by the frustrations of her situation.
